page.title: 14Local Newspaper
page.content: The Surrey Herald is a local weekly newspaper founded in 1892. It has 18 reporters of whom six are based in Chertsey, six in Walton and six in Staines. There are four photographers and eighty other staff, including printers, typesetters and editors. The Herald circulates 33,000 copies each week in Walton, Weybridge, Chertsey and Addlestone where nine out of ten people buy the paper. The Herald sees itself as an organisation to fight readers' battles and there is usually a good response. It also promotes local business by advertising. There is even a children's section of the paper: the Professor Bullseye Club which has over 5,000 members.
